<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the nation reckons with its own racism, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/06/business/corporate-america-has-failed-black-america.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">so is corporate America</a>. As the NYT reminds us, there are no black people on the senior leadership teams at JPMorgan, Wells Fargo, Bank of America, CVS, Facebook, Google, Amazon, or Microsoft.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/07/protests-spark-concerns-uptick-covid19-cases?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Protesting During a Pandemic
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Black Lives Matter" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjQ2L3Byb3Rlc3QuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Roberto Schmidt/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This weekend, hundreds of thousands of people across the U.S. turned out to protest racial injustice. In Washington, D.C., an estimated crowd of 100,000+ marched on Saturday. In Philadelphia, the crowds were "<a href="https://twitter.com/BradfordPearson/status/1269337799523733504?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unfathomable</a>."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The scale of these protests would be remarkable at any time, but coming just a few weeks after not even tumbleweeds were allowed out on city streets...it’s enough to give you whiplash.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Some public health experts expressed concern</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dr. Anthony Fauci <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/dr-fauci-protests-perfect-set-up-for-spreading-covid-19-2020-6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> on Friday the protests are a "perfect set-up for the spread of the virus." And the director of the CDC told a House panel Thursday, “I do think there is a potential, unfortunately, for this to be a seeding event.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Experts also </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/03/us/tear-gas-risks-protests-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warn</a></span><span> that police crowding arrested protesters and using tear gas (which makes people cough) could exacerbate the virus's spread. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But a contingent of public health professionals say the risks of contracting COVID-19 at a protest are outweighed by the extreme urgency of ending a deeper public health risk: systemic racism. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>An </span><span><a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Jyfn4Wd2i6bRi12ePghMHtX3ys1b7K1A/view?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">open letter</a></span><span> signed by almost 1,300 epidemiologists and public health experts states that "protests against systemic racism, which fosters the disproportionate burden of COVID-19 on Black communities and also perpetuates police violence, must be supported."</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Signatories specified that their support of protests against racial injustice =/= endorsement of other gatherings..."particularly protests against stay-home orders."</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Others are calling it a <a href="https://gfile.thedispatch.com/p/the-treason-of-epidemiologists?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">flip-flop</a> that erodes public trust in health officials, who for the past few months have been adamant that people need to stay home, social distance, and take other precautions. Many conservatives argue the current stance of these authorities <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/magazine/2020/06/04/public-health-protests-301534?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">is unfair</a>, especially to small businesses that were forced to close because of COVID-19 restrictions. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>We’ll see in a few weeks whether COVID-19 caseloads spike. Because states are continuing to ease restrictions, it may be difficult to track transmission from one specific event, whether it's a protest or the reopening of <a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1268573469542842368?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Las Vegas casinos</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">+ If you did attend a protest, the CDC director recommends you get tested for COVID-19 within three to seven days of being out in public. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MUNICIPAL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/07/protestors-call-local-governments-defund-police?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Protesters' Rallying Cry: Defund the Police
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Defunding the police" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjQzL2RlZnVuZGluZ190aGVfcG9saWNlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jay L. Clendenin / Los Angeles Times via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Friday, Washington, D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser organized the painting of “Black Lives Matter” on a street leading to the White House. Yesterday, protesters tacked on a new message: “Defund The Police.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Many protesters are demanding local governments <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-minneapolis-police-defunding-explaine/explainer-us-protesters-call-to-defund-the-police-what-would-that-look-like-idUSKBN23C2I9?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shrink police budgets</a> and reinvest those funds in social programs, especially in black communities. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Advocates criticize what Reuters calls the “militarized posture” of many police departments. They also say that police are expected to address not just crime, but homelessness, addiction, and mental illness—issues that could benefit more from intervention by trained professionals. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In Minneapolis, where George Floyd was killed, a veto-proof majority of city council members </span><span><a href="https://theappeal.org/minneapolis-city-council-members-announce-intent-to-disband-the-police-department-invest-in-proven-community-led-public-safety/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pledged</a></span><span> to disband the police department and start fresh with a community-based model. The city's mayor previously </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/BlackVisionsMN/status/1269419231029927936?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told protesters</a></span><span> he wouldn’t commit to defunding the police.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Yesterday in NYC, Mayor Bill de Blasio </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/07/nyregion/deblasio-nypd-funding.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">promised</a></span><span> to cut the NYPD's $6 billion budget by an unspecified amount.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fraternal Order of Police VP Joe Gamaldi <a href="https://www.foxnews.com/media/defund-police-ridiculous-idea-joe-gamaldi?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> defunding is “completely ridiculous” and would lead to more crime.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Police spending by state and local governments has increased over the last 40 years, per the <a href="https://www.urban.org/policy-centers/cross-center-initiatives/state-and-local-finance-initiative/state-and-local-backgrounders/police-and-corrections-expenditures?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Urban Institute</a>. But it hasn't budged from just under 4% of direct general expenditures over that time period. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CITIES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/07/dont-miss-symbolism?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Reopening Begins When New York Says It Does
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="New York City" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDQvbmV3X3lvcmtfY2l0eS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Publicdomainpictures.net</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, New York City will begin the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/07/nyregion/new-york-reopening-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first phase</a> of "reopening," exactly 100 days after its first coronavirus case was confirmed.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Don't miss the symbolism.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>New York City suffered the worst outbreak in the country, with nearly 22,000 residents killed by the virus.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Major economic drivers like shopping districts, Broadway, and offices have been shuttered for months. For New Yorkers who once looked at lockdowns in China and Italy and said, "That could never happen here"...it happened here. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But with amped up testing capacity and public health measures, the city managed to <a href="https://twitter.com/ScottGottliebMD/status/1269626077808295938?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">trample the curve</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So what's in phase #1?</strong> Manufacturing, agriculture, construction, wholesale trade, and nonessential retail (for pickup). In two weeks, should virus levels remain low, the city will move into its next phase, which includes outdoor dining, offices, and hair salons.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The big question: </strong>As more companies embrace remote work, is the high cost of NYC <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/05/nyregion/coronavirus-leaving-nyc.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">worth it</a>? The number of new apartment leases in Manhattan <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/17/many-new-yorkers-fled-city-pandemic.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell 71%</a> to a decade-low of 1,407 in April.</p>

</a>
</td>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">

</h3>

Don’t Pay Interest for Nearly 14 Dog Years
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dogs do not use credit cards, but forgive us while we use the doggy calendar to demonstrate <a href="https://www.comparecredit.com/credit-cards/tips/pay-0-interest/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=6_08_20&ad_group_id=pay_0&utm_content=dog_years&utm_medium=crm&ad_position=main&placement=morning_brew&product=credit_cards" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">how good these cards are</a>:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">You won’t pay interest until 2022</strong>—almost 14 dog years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.comparecredit.com/credit-cards/tips/pay-0-interest/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=6_08_20&ad_group_id=pay_0&utm_content=dog_years&utm_medium=crm&ad_position=main&placement=morning_brew&product=credit_cards" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">All of these cards</a>, selected by Compare Credit<sup style="display: inline-block; line-height: 16px;">TM</sup>, offer 0% intro APR, with the top choice offering 0% intro APR for close to two human years. So, if you carry balance on a credit card with a higher interest rate, now’s the time to switch. Plus, they all offer <strong style="color:#000">no annual fee</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As a human, you should jump at this chance to <a href="https://www.comparecredit.com/credit-cards/tips/pay-0-interest/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=6_08_20&ad_group_id=pay_0&utm_content=dog_years&utm_medium=crm&ad_position=main&placement=morning_brew&product=credit_cards" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">get out of debt and save some money</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For the dogs out there, if your humans pick one of these <a href="https://www.comparecredit.com/credit-cards/tips/pay-0-interest/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_campaign=6_08_20&ad_group_id=pay_0&utm_content=dog_years&utm_medium=crm&ad_position=main&placement=morning_brew&product=credit_cards" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cards</a>, you’re looking at a surefire kibble windfall.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/07/goodell-video-spurred-nfl-social-media-employees-actions?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Making of Goodell's Apology Video
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">"We, the National Football League, admit we were wrong for not listening to NFL players earlier and encourage all to speak out and peacefully protest," NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell said in an <a href="https://sports.yahoo.com/roger-goodell-nfl-admits-we-were-wrong-on-player-protests-black-lives-matter-224540686.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">apology video on Friday</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How that apology came to be is a fascinating story. </strong>Last week, an NFL social media employee named Bryndon Minter was disappointed in the league's response to the protests, so he DM'd New Orleans Saints receiver Michael Thomas about working with players to "put the pressure on," Yahoo Sports <a href="https://sports.yahoo.com/nfl-video-roger-goodell-racism-black-lives-matter-players-employees-110927703.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a>.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The end result: </strong></span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/deshaunwatson/status/1268710938456268802?s=20&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">This video</a></span><span> featuring some of the league's top stars asking the NFL to listen to its players and assert that Black Lives Matter. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Minter told his boss about the plan before the video was released and was invited to a Zoom call with other managers. The league didn't try to squash the video. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then, on Friday, the NFL held an <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/apologies-protests-and-rebellion-inside-the-nfls-72-hour-awakening-11591539303?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">emotional town hall</a> with employees before Goodell recorded the mea culpa.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backdrop: </strong>The<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>NFL's fraught race relations, highlighted by former QB Colin Kaepernick's kneeling protest during the national anthem in 2016. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=On+Friday%2C+the+NFL+held+an+emotional+town+hall+with+employees+before+Commissioner+Goodell+recorded+the+mea+culpa+&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/07/goodell-video-spurred-nfl-social-media-employees-actions&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Custom stamps: </strong>Did you know you can create your own custom stamps that are valid for most popular USPS mail classes? Neither did we. This program only runs until June 10 (Wednesday), so <a href="https://photostamps.com/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">get on it now</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Because it’s in the news: </strong>Learn about the logistics of the <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EkRRo5DN9lI" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">International Space Station</a>. </p>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjQ2L3Byb3Rlc3QuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eRoberto Schmidt/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis weekend, hundreds of thousands of people across the U.S. turned out to protest racial injustice. In Washington, D.C., an estimated crowd of 100,000+ marched on Saturday. In Philadelphia, the crowds were \"\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/BradfordPearson/status/1269337799523733504?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunfathomable\u003c/a\u003e.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe scale of these protests would be remarkable at any time, but coming just a few weeks after not even tumbleweeds were allowed out on city streets...it’s enough to give you whiplash.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSome public health experts expressed concern\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDr. Anthony Fauci \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/dr-fauci-protests-perfect-set-up-for-spreading-covid-19-2020-6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e on Friday the protests are a \"perfect set-up for the spread of the virus.\" And the director of the CDC told a House panel Thursday, “I do think there is a potential, unfortunately, for this to be a seeding event.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eExperts also \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/03/us/tear-gas-risks-protests-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewarn\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that police crowding arrested protesters and using tear gas (which makes people cough) could exacerbate the virus's spread. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut a contingent of public health professionals say the risks of contracting COVID-19 at a protest are outweighed by the extreme urgency of ending a deeper public health risk: systemic racism. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAn \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Jyfn4Wd2i6bRi12ePghMHtX3ys1b7K1A/view?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopen letter\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e signed by almost 1,300 epidemiologists and public health experts states that \"protests against systemic racism, which fosters the disproportionate burden of COVID-19 on Black communities and also perpetuates police violence, must be supported.\"\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSignatories specified that their support of protests against racial injustice =/= endorsement of other gatherings...\"particularly protests against stay-home orders.\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOthers are calling it a \u003ca href=\"https://gfile.thedispatch.com/p/the-treason-of-epidemiologists?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eflip-flop\u003c/a\u003e that erodes public trust in health officials, who for the past few months have been adamant that people need to stay home, social distance, and take other precautions. Many conservatives argue the current stance of these authorities \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/magazine/2020/06/04/public-health-protests-301534?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eis unfair\u003c/a\u003e, especially to small businesses that were forced to close because of COVID-19 restrictions. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eWe’ll see in a few weeks whether COVID-19 caseloads spike. Because states are continuing to ease restrictions, it may be difficult to track transmission from one specific event, whether it's a protest or the reopening of \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1268573469542842368?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLas Vegas casinos\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e+ If you did attend a protest, the CDC director recommends you get tested for COVID-19 within three to seven days of being out in public. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nProtesters' Rallying Cry: Defund the Police\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Defunding the police\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMjQzL2RlZnVuZGluZ190aGVfcG9saWNlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eJay L. Clendenin / Los Angeles Times via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Friday, Washington, D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser organized the painting of “Black Lives Matter” on a street leading to the White House. Yesterday, protesters tacked on a new message: “Defund The Police.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMany protesters are demanding local governments \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-minneapolis-police-defunding-explaine/explainer-us-protesters-call-to-defund-the-police-what-would-that-look-like-idUSKBN23C2I9?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshrink police budgets\u003c/a\u003e and reinvest those funds in social programs, especially in black communities. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAdvocates criticize what Reuters calls the “militarized posture” of many police departments. They also say that police are expected to address not just crime, but homelessness, addiction, and mental illness—issues that could benefit more from intervention by trained professionals. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn Minneapolis, where George Floyd was killed, a veto-proof majority of city council members \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://theappeal.org/minneapolis-city-council-members-announce-intent-to-disband-the-police-department-invest-in-proven-community-led-public-safety/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epledged\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to disband the police department and start fresh with a community-based model. The city's mayor previously \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/BlackVisionsMN/status/1269419231029927936?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold protesters\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e he wouldn’t commit to defunding the police.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eYesterday in NYC, Mayor Bill de Blasio \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/07/nyregion/deblasio-nypd-funding.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epromised\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to cut the NYPD's $6 billion budget by an unspecified amount.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFraternal Order of Police VP Joe Gamaldi \u003ca width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDQvbmV3X3lvcmtfY2l0eS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePublicdomainpictures.net\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eToday, New York City will begin the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/07/nyregion/new-york-reopening-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst phase\u003c/a\u003e of \"reopening,\" exactly 100 days after its first coronavirus case was confirmed.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDon't miss the symbolism.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNew York City suffered the worst outbreak in the country, with nearly 22,000 residents killed by the virus.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMajor economic drivers like shopping districts, Broadway, and offices have been shuttered for months. For New Yorkers who once looked at lockdowns in China and Italy and said, \"That could never happen here\"...it happened here. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut with amped up testing capacity and public health measures, the city managed to \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/ScottGottliebMD/status/1269626077808295938?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etrample the curve\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo what's in phase #1?\u003c/strong\u003e Manufacturing, agriculture, construction, wholesale trade, and nonessential retail (for pickup). In two weeks, should virus levels remain low, the city will move into its next phase, which includes outdoor dining, offices, and hair salons.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe big question: \u003c/strong\u003eAs more companies embrace remote work, is the high cost of NYC \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/05/nyregion/coronavirus-leaving-nyc.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eworth it\u003c/a\u003e? The number of new apartment leases in Manhattan \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/17/many-new-yorkers-fled-city-pandemic.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell 71%\u003c/a\u003e to a decade-low of 1,407 in April.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL Video\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\"We, the National Football League, admit we were wrong for not listening to NFL players earlier and encourage all to speak out and peacefully protest,\" NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell said in an \u003ca href=\"https://sports.yahoo.com/roger-goodell-nfl-admits-we-were-wrong-on-player-protests-black-lives-matter-224540686.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eapology video on Friday\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow that apology came to be is a fascinating story. \u003c/strong\u003eLast week, an NFL social media employee named Bryndon Minter was disappointed in the league's response to the protests, so he DM'd New Orleans Saints receiver Michael Thomas about working with players to \"put the pressure on,\" Yahoo Sports \u003ca href=\"https://sports.yahoo.com/nfl-video-roger-goodell-racism-black-lives-matter-players-employees-110927703.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe end result: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/deshaunwatson/status/1268710938456268802?s=20\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eThis video\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e featuring some of the league's top stars asking the NFL to listen to its players and assert that Black Lives Matter. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMinter told his boss about the plan before the video was released and was invited to a Zoom call with other managers. The league didn't try to squash the video. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen, on Friday, the NFL held an \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/apologies-protests-and-rebellion-inside-the-nfls-72-hour-awakening-11591539303?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eemotional town hall\u003c/a\u003e with employees before Goodell recorded the mea culpa.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backdrop: \u003c/strong\u003eThe\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eNFL's fraught race relations, highlighted by former QB Colin Kaepernick's kneeling protest during the national anthem in 2016. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F06%2F07%2Fgoodell-video-spurred-nfl-social-media-employees-actions\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
